definitions.definition: without interest or character; dull and nondescript.
definitions.example: grey, faceless men

definitions.definition: (of financial or trading activity) not accounted for in official statistics.
definitions.example: the grey economy

definitions.definition: of a colour intermediate between black and white, as of ashes or lead.
definitions.example: grey flannel trousers

definitions.definition: marked with or having stripes.
definitions.example: a green-striped coat

definitions.definition: mark with stripes.
definitions.example: her body was striped with bands of sunlight

definitions.definition: (of a drink) large and refreshing, and in which alcohol, if present, is not concentrated.
longitude.
measuring a great distance from end to end.
definitions.example: a long corridor

definitions.definition: lasting or taking a great amount of time.
definitions.example: a long and distinguished career

definitions.definition: relatively great in extent.
definitions.example: write a long report

definitions.definition: (of odds or a chance) reflecting or representing a low level of probability.
definitions.example: winning against long odds

definitions.definition: a long period.
definitions.example: see you before long

definitions.definition: a long sound such as a long signal in Morse code or a long vowel or syllable.
definitions.example: two longs and a short

definitions.definition: for a long time.
definitions.example: we hadn't known them long

definitions.definition: have a strong wish or desire.
definitions.example: she longed for a little more excitement

definitions.definition: (added to nouns) for the duration of.
definitions.example: lifelong

definitions.definition: (with reference to the ball in sport) at, to, or over a great distance.
definitions.example: the Cambridge side played the ball long

definitions.definition: shaped like a circle or cylinder.
definitions.example: she was seated at a small, round table

definitions.definition: (of a number) expressed in convenient units rather than exactly, for example to the nearest whole number or multiple of ten.
definitions.example: the size of the fleet is given in round numbers

definitions.definition: not omitting or disguising anything; frank.
definitions.example: she berated him in good round terms

definitions.definition: a circular piece of something.
definitions.example: cut the pastry into rounds

definitions.definition: an act of visiting a number of people or places in turn.
definitions.example: she did the rounds of her family to say goodbye

definitions.definition: each of a sequence of sessions in a process, typically characterized by development between one session and another.
definitions.example: the two sides held three rounds of talks

definitions.definition: a regularly recurring sequence of activities.
definitions.example: their lives were a daily round of housework and laundry

definitions.definition: the amount of ammunition needed to fire one shot.
definitions.example: the gun can fire 30 rounds a second

definitions.definition: so as to rotate or cause rotation; with circular motion.
definitions.example: a plane circled round overhead

definitions.definition: so as to rotate and face in the opposite direction.
definitions.example: he swung round to face her

definitions.definition: so as to surround someone or something.
definitions.example: everyone crowded round

definitions.definition: so as to reach a new place or position, typically by moving to the other side of something.
definitions.example: he made his way round to the back of the building

definitions.definition: used to suggest idle and purposeless motion or activity.
definitions.example: he was driving round aimlessly

definitions.definition: so as to give support and companionship.
definitions.example: if one girl is distraught the others will rally round

definitions.definition: on every side of (a focal point).
definitions.example: the area round the school

definitions.definition: so as to encircle (someone or something).
definitions.example: he wrapped the blanket round him

definitions.definition: following an approximately circular route past (a corner or obstacle).
definitions.example: a bus appeared round the corner

definitions.definition: so as to cover or take in the whole area of (a place).
definitions.example: she went round the house and saw that all the windows were barred

definitions.definition: pass and go round (something) so as to move on in a changed direction.
definitions.example: the ship rounded the cape and sailed north

definitions.definition: alter (a number) to one less exact but more convenient for calculations.
definitions.example: we'll round the weight up to the nearest kilo

definitions.definition: give a round shape to.
definitions.example: a lathe that rounded chair legs

definitions.definition: shaped like a sphere.
definitions.example: a round glass ball

definitions.definition: (of a voice) rich and mellow; not harsh.
definitions.example: his rich, round voice went down well with the listeners

definitions.definition: (of a knitting stitch) made by putting the needle through the front of the stitch from left to right.
mourn or lament.
not decorated or elaborate; simple or basic in character.
definitions.example: good plain food

definitions.definition: easy to perceive or understand; clear.
definitions.example: the advantages were plain to see

definitions.definition: not distinguished by any particular beauty; ordinary looking.
definitions.example: a plain, round-faced woman

definitions.definition: sheer; simple (used for emphasis).
definitions.example: the main problem is just plain exhaustion

definitions.definition: used for emphasis.
definitions.example: perhaps the youth was just plain stupid

definitions.definition: clearly or unequivocally.
definitions.example: I'm finished with you, I'll tell you plain

definitions.definition: a large area of flat land with few trees.
definitions.example: the coastal plain

definitions.definition: moving or capable of moving at high speed.
definitions.example: a fast and powerful car

definitions.definition: (of a clock or watch) showing a time ahead of the correct time.
definitions.example: I keep my watch fifteen minutes fast

definitions.definition: (of a time) coming immediately after the time of writing or speaking.
definitions.example: we'll go to Corfu next year

definitions.definition: coming immediately after the present one in order, rank, or space.
definitions.example: the woman in the next room

definitions.definition: on the first or soonest occasion after the present; immediately afterwards.
definitions.example: he wondered what would happen next

definitions.definition: following in the specified order.
definitions.example: Jo was the next oldest after Martin

definitions.definition: (of rhythm) simple and straightforward.
multiply (a number) by itself.
definitions.example: 5 squared equals 25

definitions.definition: a plane figure with four equal straight sides and four right angles.
definitions.example: a grid of ruled squares

definitions.definition: the product of a number multiplied by itself.
definitions.example: a circle's area is proportional to the square of its radius

definitions.definition: having the shape or approximate shape of a square.
definitions.example: a square table

definitions.definition: denoting a unit of measurement equal to the area of a square whose side is of the unit specified.
definitions.example: 30,000 square feet of new gallery space

definitions.definition: at right angles; perpendicular.
definitions.example: these lines must be square to the top and bottom marked edges

definitions.definition: level or parallel.
definitions.example: place two pieces of wood one on top of the other, ensuring that they are exactly square

definitions.definition: (of two people) owing nothing to each other.
definitions.example: an acknowledgement that we are square

definitions.definition: directly; straight.
definitions.example: the ball hit me square in the forehead

definitions.definition: make square or rectangular; give a square or rectangular cross section to.
definitions.example: you can square off the other edge

definitions.definition: make compatible; reconcile.
definitions.example: I'm able to square my profession with my religious beliefs

definitions.definition: balance (an account).
definitions.example: institutions are anxious to square their books before the election

definitions.definition: bring (one's shoulders) into a position in which they appear square and broad, typically to prepare oneself for a difficult task or event.
definitions.example: chin up, shoulders squared, she stepped into the room

definitions.definition: an L-shaped or T-shaped instrument used for obtaining or testing right angles.
definitions.example: a carpenter's square

definitions.definition: an open, typically four-sided, area surrounded by buildings in a village, town, or city.
definitions.example: a market square

definitions.definition: moving or operating, or designed to do so, only at a low speed; not quick or fast.
definitions.example: until recently diesel cars were slow and noisy

definitions.definition: (of a clock or watch) showing a time earlier than the correct time.
definitions.example: the clock was five minutes slow

definitions.definition: brown colour or pigment.
definitions.example: the brown of his eyes

definitions.definition: of a colour produced by mixing red, yellow, and blue, as of dark wood or rich soil.
definitions.example: an old brown coat

definitions.definition: having an even and regular surface; free from perceptible projections, lumps, or indentations.
definitions.example: smooth flat rocks

definitions.definition: (of movement) without jerks.
definitions.example: the trucks gave a smooth ride

definitions.definition: (of a person or their manner) suavely charming in a way regarded as possibly insincere.
definitions.example: his voice was infuriatingly smooth

definitions.definition: (of food or drink) without harshness or bitterness.
definitions.example: a lovely, smooth, very fruity wine

definitions.definition: give (something) a flat, regular surface or appearance.
definitions.example: she smoothed out the newspaper

definitions.definition: deal successfully with (a problem or difficulty).
definitions.example: these doctrinal disputes were smoothed over

definitions.definition: in a way that is without difficulties.
definitions.example: the course of true love never did run smooth

definitions.definition: coming after all others in time or order; final.
definitions.example: they caught the last bus

definitions.definition: most recent in time; latest.
definitions.example: last year

definitions.definition: only remaining.
definitions.example: it's our last hope

definitions.definition: on the last occasion before the present; previously.
definitions.example: a woman last heard of in Cornwall

definitions.definition: after all others in order or sequence.
definitions.example: the last-named film

definitions.definition: (especially in enumerating points) lastly.
definitions.example: and last, I'd like to thank you all for coming

definitions.definition: the last person or thing; the one occurring, mentioned, or acting after all others.
definitions.example: the last of their guests had gone

definitions.definition: (of a process, activity, or state) continue for a specified period of time.
definitions.example: the guitar solo lasted for twenty minutes

definitions.definition: continue to operate or remain usable for a considerable or specified length of time.
definitions.example: the car is built to last

definitions.definition: a shoemaker's model for shaping or repairing a shoe or boot.
definitions.example: the iron lasts on which he mended our shoes

definitions.definition: (of a person) having acquired much knowledge through study.
definitions.example: a learned, generous, and notoriously absent-minded man

definitions.definition: gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught.
definitions.example: they'd started learning French

definitions.definition: (of fruit or grain) developed to the point of readiness for harvesting and eating.
definitions.example: a ripe tomato

definitions.definition: having arrived at the fitting stage or time for a particular action or purpose).
definitions.example: land ripe for development

definitions.definition: (of a person's age) advanced.
definitions.example: she lived to a ripe old age

definitions.definition: (of a female fish or insect) ready to lay eggs or spawn.
definitions.example: ripe females will stop and spawn with one or more males

definitions.definition: free from moisture or liquid; not wet or moist.
definitions.example: the jacket kept me warm and dry

definitions.definition: (of information, writing, etc.) dully factual.
definitions.example: the dry facts of the matter

definitions.definition: (of a joke or sense of humour) subtle and expressed in a matter-of-fact way.
definitions.example: he delighted his friends with a dry, covert sense of humour

definitions.definition: prohibiting the sale or consumption of alcoholic drink.
definitions.example: the country is strictly dry, in accordance with Islamic law

definitions.definition: (of an alcoholic drink) not sweet.
definitions.example: a dry, medium-bodied red wine

definitions.definition: become dry.
definitions.example: waiting for the paint to dry

definitions.definition: theatrical slang
definitions.example: a colleague of mine once dried in the middle of a scene

definitions.definition: containing or holding as much or as many as possible; having no empty space.
definitions.example: waste bins full of rubbish

definitions.definition: not lacking or omitting anything; complete.
definitions.example: a full range of sports facilities

definitions.definition: (of a person's figure or part of the body) plump or rounded.
definitions.example: she had full lips

definitions.definition: the period, point, or state of the greatest fullness or strength.
very.
definitions.example: he knew full well she was too polite to barge in

definitions.definition: black English
definitions.example: he full up the house with bawling

definitions.definition: clean, shrink, and felt (cloth) by heat, pressure, and moisture.
definitions.example: weaving and fulling were all formerly part of the normal domestic scene

definitions.definition: straight; directly.
definitions.example: she turned her head and looked full into his face

definitions.definition: gather or pleat (fabric) so as to make a garment full.
definitions.example: a straight piece fulled into a small band at the top

definitions.definition: affected by alcohol to the extent of losing control of one's faculties or behaviour.
definitions.example: he was so drunk he lurched from wall to wall

definitions.definition: a person who is drunk or who habitually drinks to excess.
definitions.example: we staggered up the path like a couple of drunks

definitions.definition: take (a liquid) into the mouth and swallow.
definitions.example: we sat by the fire, drinking our tea

definitions.definition: watch or listen to something with eager pleasure or interest.
definitions.example: she strolled to the window to drink in the view

definitions.definition: low in price, especially in relation to similar items or services.
definitions.example: local buses were reliable and cheap

definitions.definition: of little worth because achieved in a discreditable way requiring little effort.
definitions.example: her moment of cheap triumph

definitions.definition: at or for a low price.
definitions.example: a house that was going cheap because of the war

definitions.definition: the soft tender flesh below the growing part of a fingernail or toenail.
prompt to understand, think, or learn; intelligent.
definitions.example: it was quick of him to spot the mistake

definitions.definition: at a fast rate; quickly.
definitions.example: he'll find some place where he can make money quicker

definitions.definition: moving fast or doing something in a short time.
definitions.example: in the qualifying session he was two seconds quicker than his teammate

definitions.definition: tenuto.
equivalent to the product of five and two; one more than nine; 10.
definitions.example: the last ten years
